metadata.title: ప్రసాదం దద్యోధనం - Method 2 | Prasadam Temple Style Curd Rice Recipe in Telugu by Vismai Food
metadata.description: Prasadam Daddojanam - Method 2 | Prasadam Temple Style Curd Rice Recipe in Telugu by Vismai Food. We have followed the temple prasadam style for preparing Dadhyodanam recipe in Telugu. Daddojanam is also called curd rice.

transcription_english: [00:00] Rama is the son-in-law of Telugu households, and Sita is the daughter.
[00:04] The Vismai Food team wishes that the grace and compassion of our worshipped deities, Sita and Rama, be upon every viewer.
[00:13] Today's special dish is Prasadam Daddojanam (Curd Rice).
[00:15] There is a lot of difference between the Daddojanam made usually and the Daddojanam given as Prasadam in temples.
[00:22] Naturally, we all call curd rice as "Daddojanam". The correct word is "Dadhyodanam".
[00:27] According to Agama Shastras, there are certain methods and procedures for the offerings made to God. Only then does that taste come.
[00:35] You will not see this recipe anywhere on YouTube.
[00:39] This is a recipe made after inquiring with those who make Prasadam vedically.
[00:44] Offer this Prasadam to Sita and Rama on Rama Navami and receive their complete grace and compassion.
[00:52] First, take one cup of rice that has been washed and soaked for an hour in a cooker.
[00:57] Pour one and a half cups of milk and one cup of water into it.
[01:02] Let it cook for three whistles on medium flame. Only then will the rice cook softly.
[01:09] After cooking the rice soft, add salt to taste and mash the rice softly while it is still hot.
[01:15] Any item offered to God must be hot. Cold items are not suitable, and fermented (sour) items are not suitable either.
[01:22] That is why the Daddojanam given to us in temples is hot. Have you noticed?
[01:29] After mashing the rice softly, add two tablespoons of fresh curd.
[01:33] Mix well while adding milk, a quarter cup at a time.
[01:37] We need at least 300ml of milk for this rice. So add it little by little while mixing.
[01:43] If it is new rice, this Prasadam will be even tastier.
[01:46] As I said earlier, the Prasadam must be hot.
[01:50] If you add curd to hot rice, it curdles. That's why they use very little curd and mix this Daddojanam purely with milk.
[01:58] Now do you understand why this Prasadam is so delicious?
[02:02] Now heat two teaspoons of oil for tempering, add half a teaspoon of mustard seeds, half a teaspoon of cumin seeds...
[02:07] Add half a teaspoon of chana dal, half a teaspoon of urad dal, two dry chillies, a sprig of curry leaves and fry.
[02:14] We usually add asafoetida in tempering. But they do not add asafoetida in the Daddojanam given as Prasadam. That is why I did not add it.
[02:22] If you like, you can use black pepper instead of dry chillies in this.
[02:26] Now add this tempering to the hot curd rice and mix.
[02:30] Do not add too much tempering or oil. The tempering flavor dominates the deliciousness of the curd rice.
[02:36] That's it! The very tasty Prasadam Daddojanam is ready.
[02:40] Offer it to God once and taste it, you will be amazed by the taste of this Prasadam.
[02:46] You will get the exact taste of the Prasadam given in temples.
[02:50] Not just as Prasadam, even if you pack this in children's lunch box, it won't turn sour by afternoon.
[02:56] Also, if taken as breakfast in this summer, it feels very comfortable for the stomach.
[03:00] Did you like it? You must try it and definitely comment and tell us how you liked it.
